Technically the 3rd part of the Half-Life 2 series, this game is a seriously good continuation and even after experiencing HL 2 and HL 2: Ep 1, this game still surprises/amazes me with the additions and changes they made. The story is a really good continuation of what happened in HL 2: Ep 1 and is just as amazing. Gameplay is a lot like HL 2, unlike HL 2: Ep 1 which promotes a different playstyle from the 2. This game also has a feature that I seriously wish could be added to HL 2 and HL2: Ep 1 which is the fact that your flashlight uses a different power supply from your sprint and oxygen. This made dark battle sections in the other 2 games somewhat annoying since it was very costly for you to use your flashlight and sprint at the same time, really happy about that change. Will definitely recommend it BUT if you're gonna buy this, I would highly recommend you buy HL 2 and HL 2: Ep 1 to experience the story fully. You can have fun with this game alone but it's like eating a slice of pizza, you can eat only one but it's better to eat more, even more so if you eat the entire pizza (i.e. buy the Half-Life bundle).
The final non vr Half-Life game will not leave you hanging.

Good Graphics, Amazing History, Great Gameplay 10/10

It's really good. Second fav expansion (if that's what this is, Idek) in the series after Opposing Force. Improved color palette, new enemies, flashlight battery no longer runs out when you sprint (that was pretty much the only thing I didn't like about Half-Life 2), challenging but fun achievements and while you don't get any new hand-held weapons the Magnusson device is a great addition. Not to mention the OST is amazing. The mountain environments are also a blast to explore.  I also love what they did with the G-Man, instead of him just being there at the end he has an important but still enigmatic part in the story. Really recommend the game if you enjoyed the previous games and expansions.

the final episode that expands the story of the half life 2 main game.

Half-Life 2: Episode Two is the second episodic game of Half-Life 2. It's a continuation of Half-Life 2 and the first episodic game Half-Life 2: Episode One. This Episode is interesting and filled with new mechanics, new enemies, challenging battles, and achievements. Also, it gives way more info about the lore of Half-Life. Sadly, it leaves you with so many questions that need answers and in huge disbelief. The game ends when things get so much more interesting, we need a 3rd part, Half-Life 3 or Episode 3. 
The game consists of 3 modes just like Half-Life 2 and Half-Life 2: Episode One. The modes are Easy, Normal, and Hard.
1. Easy: Don't even bother playing this. It's just too easy and not a challenge at all. Difficulty: 0/10;
2. Normal: Now we talking. Balanced and challenging. Difficulty: 7/10;
3. Hard: Of all Half-Life games and episodes, this one mode is by far the hardest. Doing it all and the achievements on this mode is insanely hard. The Gnome Achievement with the car part can fuck off right now, and the fast-walking Striders are just #!&*!^. Drove me crazy for hours. Difficulty: 100/10.

Weapons: The same as Half-Life 2 and Half-Life 2: Episode One.

Multiplayer: Does not have.

In the end, by far the greatest continuation of a game, gameplay, and lore-wise. I  have seen and witnessed artists and old video games making great and successful comebacks these moments, I also believe that Valve and Gaben will deliver us a continuation of this lore and its end. If not during Gaben, maybe someone after him. I do not know when or by whom, but I do believe we will get the end and the last piece of the puzzle we deserve.

Half Life 2: Episode Two is the culmination of the Half Life series. I really enjoyed going through the series especially the HL2 games. When I got to the end, I can definitely appreciate how people have been clamouring for a sequel for ages -- it was such a cliffhanger!
